intro: Rapanea yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan boxwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue-black berries. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
